tool.name: ConsolidateShapefiles

param.name: inWorkspace
param.dialogReference: This input folder and it's subfolders will be searched.

param.name: fileFilter
param.dialogReference: A filter expression of the shapefiles you wish to search for, using Unix wildcards (e.g. *airports* would find all filenames containing airports).

param.name: out_gdb
param.dialogReference: Output Geodatabase the consolidated layers will be saved into. This must already exist.

param.name: output_FC_Name
param.dialogReference:
Name of the output feature class. If this already exists the shapefiles will be appended into it, otherwise the feature class is created based on the first shapefile found.

Note that no renaming of fields takes place, nor schema checking. Any errors from the append operation will be output by the tool so please review these carefully.

tool.summary:
This tool;

  1. Searches for shapefiles within a given folder (and it's subfolders) that match the file filter.

  2. Creates a feature class in an output geodatabase with the schema of the first shapefile found

  3. Appends all the other shapefiles into that feature class.

The tool does not perform any transformation or schema mapping between the shapefiles. It's simply finds the files and appends them.
